name: MP3 Player
description: This module allows you to play MP3 music directly on the machine running Gladys (on the Raspberry Pi for example).
instructionsHTML:
Need Gladys >= 3.3.

Installation

  • Download this module in Gladys. Do not reboot for the moment.
  • Transfer your music on your Raspberry Pi in a specific folder. (Using FileZilla for example) Keep the absolute path of the folder.
  • Then, define in Gladys a Gladys param in Parameters => Parameters called GLADYS_MP3_FOLDER and put in value the absolute path of your music folder.
  • Reboot Gladys
  • Go to the modules view and click on Configure on the module view.
  • Go to the Device view, you now have a MP3 Player Device. Enter the room where your MP3 Player device is.
  • You can now control your music!

Usage

  • Go to Parameters => Boxs and add the music box to the home screen.
  • Then, go the home screen, select the room where your MP3 Player device is. You can now control the music!
  • If you want, you can ask Gladys by message to play/pause some music, just try ;)
instructionsMarkDown:
Need Gladys >= 3.3.

### Installation

- Download this module in Gladys. Do not reboot for the moment.
- Transfer your music on your Raspberry Pi in a specific folder. (Using [FileZilla](https://filezilla-project.org/) for example) Keep the absolute path of the folder.
- Then, define in Gladys a Gladys param in `Parameters` => `Parameters` called `GLADYS_MP3_FOLDER` and put in value the absolute path of your music folder.
- Reboot Gladys
- Go to the modules view and click on `Configure` on the module view.
- Go to the Device view, you now have a MP3 Player Device. Enter the room where your MP3 Player device is.
- You can now control your music!

### Usage

- Go to `Parameters` => `Boxs` and add the music box to the home screen.
- Then, go the home screen, select the room where your MP3 Player device is. You can now control the music!
- If you want, you can ask Gladys by message to play/pause some music, just try ;)
